title: Request for Body-Worn Camera Footage: Victor Antonio Delgadillo (8/9/2024)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Request for Body-Worn Camera Footage: Victor Antonio Delgadillo (8/9/2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All unedited body-worn camera / bodycam recordings related to the following law enforcement critical incident:

Incident Date: August 9, 2024
Location: 1440 block of N. State College Boulevard, Anaheim, CA
Victim Name: Victor Antonio Delgadillo

I am specifically requesting the unedited body-worn camera recordings captured by all officers present for the full duration of the incident, including audio recordings associated with the footage.

If any portion of the requested footage must be redacted, I ask that you clearly indicate the portions that have been redacted and provide an explanation of the legal basis for the redactions. If the requested footage is withheld in its entirety, please provide a detailed explanation citing relevant public records exemption(s).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wayne Byun

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Bureau of Consular Affairs Implementation of Executive Order 14168
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I seek any and all records and all electronic communications—emails, memos, SMS texts, messages sent on encrypted apps like Signal, along with attachments—sent or received between January 20, 2025 and February 21, 2025 and in the possession of the Assistant Secretary for Consular Affairs (or anyone acting in that capacity) pertaining to the State Department's implementation of Executive Order 14168, otherwise known as “Defending Women from Gender Ideology Extremism and Restoring Biological Truth to the Federal Government.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Angela Watercutter

title: Evergreen Solutions

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Greetings,

I hope this email finds you well. We at Evergreen Solutions, LLC, are conducting a compensation study on behalf of our client and I am writing to make a formal open records request. We are requesting an electronic copy of your staff and faculty database as well as relevant documents such as job descriptions, collective bargaining agreements, and pay plans. Attached is a survey template to assist with the data collection; however, we will accept data in the manner most convenient for you. 
 
Staff Census Information requested:

Job Titles
Classification Title
Pay Grades
Pay Ranges (Minimum and Maximum)
Actual Salaries
Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) Status
Staff Handbook
 
I also kindly request answers to the following questions related to the compensation study:
 
How are salaries adjusted for your organization (e.g., COLA, Longevity, performance, etc.)?
What is your current turnover rate?
What is your current average tenure for an employee?
Date your current compensation plan was implemented.
Date of the last salary adjustment?
How frequently are job descriptions updated?
 
For the faculty database, I am requesting the following information:

Faculty Census:
Rank (if applicable) 
Classification Title (if faculty holds other positions other than teaching such as Dean, Chair, Coordinators,etc)
Highest Degree Held 
Pay Grade 
Pay Ranges (Min& Max) 
Current Step (if on a step plan) 
Contract Length (in days and/or months) 
Annual Base Salary with no additives 
Annual Salary with any additives 
Discipline (Not to be confused with department, the distinct/specific subject the faculty member teaches; Ex: Microbiology)
Department
CIP Code (if available - by individual incumbent) 


Additionally, copies of the following documents, if available: 
 
Copy of all faculty pay plans
Employee Benefit Information (Holidays Off, Health Insurance, Etc)  
Salary Adjustment Policy (Longevity, performance, COLA, etc)
Any Collective Bargaining Agreements 
Current Turnover Rate
Current Average Tenure
Date that your current pay plan was implemented
Date of your last salary adjustment to pay plan
How frequently are your job descriptions updated
Do you have a planned salary adjustment to your compensation structures for the next fiscal year? If so, by what amount?                           
Please list/attach and supplements/additives that faculty are compensated for duties outside of instruction
Faculty Handbooks 
Adjunct Rates/Pay Plan 
Overload Rates 
Rates for compensation for faculty leadership- Deans, Coordinators, Department Chairs  
Do you compensate faculty differently based on area of discipline?  If yes, please provide details.
Do you have any form of additional compensation for Large Class Size?  If yes, please provide details.
Do you have an education incentive at your institution?  If yes, please provide details.
 
I understand that public records requests may involve administrative processes and associated fees, as allowed by law. Please inform me of any fees and the estimated timeframe for fulfilling this request. If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific legal grounds for the refusal.
 
Please consider this email as a formal request for public records under the applicable open records laws. If there are any questions or additional details needed to process this request, please do not hesitate to contact me.
 
I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. Your cooperation in ensuring transparency and access to public records is greatly appreciated.

Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to mandatory exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive?: Yes
Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to discretionary exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive? Yes



Evergreen Solutions

 

Very Respectfully,

 

Alisia Rios, MSIOP

Data Analyst – She/Her

 

Evergreen Solutions, LLC

2528 Barrington Circle Unit 201

Tallahassee, FL 32308

 

Office:   (850) 383-0111

Cell:       (850) 661-0341

Email:    alisia@consultevergreen.com

Partnering with public-sector clients to effect positive change

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alisia Rios

communications.subject: Re: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Request for Body-worn Camera Footage: Nikolas Acosta (January 06, 2023)
communications.communication:
Good day,
I have received your request for Inspection of Public Records. We are in the process of gathering that information.  I will have a response to you within the time frame designated by the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act.
Due to the high volume of lapel video and other requests, it may take us longer than normal to provide the requested records.  We hope to have the request completed in a few weeks, but if we can provide the records sooner, we will be in touch.
In response to your inquiry regarding cost, we charge $25 per DVD-R/thumb drive.  If you prefer to utilize our website NextRequest, if the file sizes exceed 2GB there is a $25 free, and if the total file sizes exceed 16GB, the there is a $50 fee.
Sincerely,


Georgia A Davey

Records Supervisor/Records Custodian

Roswell Police Department Records

(575) 624-6770 ext 4184

(575) 624-6780 (fax)



Roswell Police Department

“in pursuit of excellence”

communications.subject: Fw: [EXTERNAL] Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Request for Body-worn Camera Footage: Daryl Edward Vance (September 01, 2023)
communications.communication:
This email serves as the City of Detroit’s response to the above-referenced matter. Your request was received at the City of Detroit Law Department Freedom of Information Act Section via facsimile or email, on February 21, 2025. Because your request was received by electronic transmission, pursuant to Section 5(1) of the Michigan Freedom of Information Act (the “Act”), MCL 15.235(1); it is deemed to have been received at the Law Department on the next business day, February 24, 2025.

Pursuant to Section 5(2) of the Act, MCL 15.235(2), the City’s response is due within five (5) business days. However, due to the nature and the scope of your request and the volume of the requests received by the City, we are extending the City’s response deadline by ten (10) additional business days in accordance with Section 5(2) (d) of the Act, MCL 15.235(2) (d). Therefore, your request will be granted, denied, or granted in part and denied in part on or before March 17, 2025.

Your request is being handled by Devin Farrelly. If you have questions regarding your request, or if you did not provide an email address in your request, please forward it to Devin Farrelly at farrellyd@detroitmi.gov<mailto:farrellyd@detroitmi.gov> to provide you a response more readily than by regular mail or fax. Mail and fax are not preferred at this time since they both require in-office support. We thank you in advance for your understanding.







Jack Dietrich, Supervising Assistant Corporation Counsel City of Detroit Law Department

313-237-5030



This communication, along with any attachments, is intended only for the use of the addressee and contains legally privileged and confidential information.  If you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any dissemination, distribution or copying of any information contained in, or attached to this communication, is strictly prohibited and you are requested to contact the sender for instructions to return the document.

title: FOIA Request: Communications and Documents re DOGE

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All records concerning the decision to draft, send, and publish the US Attorney's Office for the District of Columbia's ("Office") February 3, 2025 letter to Mr. Elon Musk, sent via X.com to "@elonmusk" and published on X.com under "@EagleEdMartin."

2. All records concerning the decision to draft, send, and publish the Office's February 7, 2025 letter to Mr. Elon Musk and Mr. Steve Davis, sent via X.com to "@elonmusk" and published on X.com under "@EagleEdMartin."

3. All records concerning "the referral of individuals and networks who appear to be stealing government property and/or threatening government employees" described in the Office's February 7, 2025 letter to Elon Musk and Steve Davis. 

4. All records concerning communications between the Office and DOGE (f/k/a United States Digital Service) concerning the topics discussed in the (a) the February 3, 2025 letter or (b) the February 7, 2025 letter

5. All records concerning communications between the Office  and Elon Musk concerning the topics discussed in the (a) the February 3, 2025 letter or (b) the February 7, 2025 letter

6. All records concerning communications between the Office and X.com or X Corp. concerning the topics discussed in the (a) the February 3, 2025 letter or (b) the February 7, 2025 letter

7. All records concerning communications between the Office and WIRED (or Wired.com) concerning the topics discussed in the (a) the February 3, 2025 letter or (b) the February 7, 2025 letter

8. All records concerning communications to or from the Office  concerning the publication of one or more of following names: Akash Bobba; Edward Coristine; Luke Farritor; Gautier Cole Killian; Gavin Kilger; or Ethan Shaotran.

9. All records concerning  communications to or from the Office  about the X.com account "@RayInsideOut."

10. Any direct messages received at or sent from the X.com account "@EagleEdMartin" concerning (a) the February 3, 2025 letter; (b) the February 7, 2025 letter; or (c) the publication of the six names referenced above.

"Communications" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, or any other form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

REQUEST FOR EXPEDITED PROCESSING:

I request that this request be expedited under 28 CFR § 16.5(e)(ii) for the following reasons:

1. I certify the following to be true and correct: My organization is primarily engaged in disseminating information. The Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression (FIRE) maintains a news website at https://thefire.org/news, through which its staff members regularly publish news stories and editorial content concerning the activities of governments, government officials, and other persons or organizations of public concern. I am a staff member of FIRE. I frequently write about matters involving the First Amendment and press freedom, including on FIRE's website. 

2. The requested information concerns an actual or alleged government activity, namely the U.S. Attorney for the District of Columbia becoming involved in a dispute over the disclosure of names of individuals involved with DOGE/US Digital Service and its acts. 

3. The requested information extends beyond the public's right to know about government activity generally and instead has a particular value that would be lost if not processed on an expedited basis. The information pertains to a breaking news story of public interest. The U.S. Attorney added to the newsworthiness of this matter, posting two recent letters on Twitter threatening investigation of  those who publish information related to DOGE's activities and related current events (those Twitter posts have tens of thousands of engagements). That issue has attracted a wide range of recent news media coverage, including the numerous articles identified below.  The information has value that would be lost if not processed on an expedited basis because it concerns the policies and actions of federal law enforcement concerning the publication of information related to DOGE and related current events. Those policies and decisions are uncertain, as indicated by the US Attorney's letters. Disclosing policies and information pertaining to ongoing decisions and policies facilitates the ability of the public, the press, and advocates to provide feedback with respect to those decisions and policies. If that information is only disclosed months or years later, it will inhibit the ability of the public to understand how its current officials are making decisions.

Examples of social media postings and recent articles demonstrating the public's ongoing and current interest in this information include:

X.com:
https://x.com/EagleEdMartin/status/1887901087983689761
https://x.com/EagleEdMartin/status/1886456136032817488
https://x.com/USAO_DC/status/1886537850390483276

The New Republic: https://newrepublic.com/post/191087/us-attorney-threaten-target-opponents-elon-musk-doge
The Washington Post: https://www.washingtonpost.com/dc-md-va/2025/02/03/martin-supports-for-musk-doge/
The New York TImes: https://www.nytimes.com/2025/02/12/business/media/elon-musk-doxxing-marko-elez.html
Western Journals: https://www.westernjournal.com/elon-just-got-legendary-letter-trumps-doj-threats-doge-finished/
Slate: https://slate.com/news-and-politics/2025/02/trump-musk-doge-staffer-resigns-ed-martin-us-attorney-jan-6.html
Axios: https://www.axios.com/2025/02/07/musk-doge-us-attorney-inquiry
Newsweek: https://www.newsweek.com/trump-us-attorney-ed-martin-inquiry-elon-musk-2027976

REQUEST FOR A FEE WAIVER OR REDUCED FEES:

I request, under 28 CFR § 16.10(k), a waiver or reduction of fees for the following reasons:

1. Disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because its disclosure would shed light on the operations or activities of the government. The requested information pertains specifically to the policies, procedures, and practices of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the District of Columbia as it pertains to the publications of information about government activities, implicating the Speech and Press clauses of the First Amendment.

2. Disclosure of the requested information would be likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of those operations or activities. Disclosure of the requested information would meaningfully inform the public about the Office's activities and operations, as the information pertains to the policies and underlying information driving decisions by senior law enforcement officials. Disclosing the policies and other information would demonstrate the bases for those decisions, which have attracted substantial public attention, as demonstrated by the articles and press statements cited above. That information is not in the public domain.

3. Disclosure of the requested information will contribute to the understanding of a reasonably broad audience of persons interested in the subject, as opposed to the individual understanding of the requester. The requestor is a licensed attorney who practices First Amendment law, including its application to members of the press. As such, the requestor will be able to effectively convey information to the public. Further, the requestor is a representative of the news media. The requestor and his employer, the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, gather information of potential interest to a segment of the public, turns that information into distinct works (including through its news website, located at https://thefire.org/news, and distributes that information to the public. The information requested here relates to information that is about current events or that would be of current interest to the public. The requestor's past publication record (in addition to FIRE's articles) can be found at https://thefire.org/news.

4. The requested information is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester. The requestor works for a nonprofit organization and the records are not sought for a commercial purpose.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

JT Morris
